issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: Storage state is ignored when building the machines list.  Failed storage removal is not immediate so clients may be directed to bad locations.  The client recovers but it's less than ideal.
fields.summary: BlockManager#createLocatedBlocks may return blocks on failed storages

comments.body: Attaching initial patch that removes failed storages and adjusts the machines array if needed.

The array trimming should be a rare event, as failed storage is promptly removed when reported.
+1 the patch looks good.
I've committed this to trunk, branch-2 and branch-2.8. Thanks for fixing this, [~kshukla].

SUCCESS: Integrated in Hadoop-trunk-Commit #10218 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/10218/])
HDFS-10343. BlockManager#createLocatedBlocks may return blocks on failed (kihwal: rev 57369a678c4c51627fe9a654e697a906a6bef123)
